definitions.definition: used to say what is the right thing to do

examples.text: They ought to have apologized *(= but they didn't)*.
Such things ought not to be allowed.
He oughtn't to have been driving so fast.
‘Ought I to write to say thank you?’ ‘Yes, I think you ought (to).’

definitions.definition: used to say what you expect or would like to happen

examples.text: Children ought to be able to read by the age of 7.

definitions.definition: used to say what you advise or recommend

examples.text: We ought to be leaving now.
This is delicious. You ought to try some.
You ought to have come to the meeting. It was interesting.

definitions.definition: used to say what has probably happened or is probably true

examples.text: If he started out at nine, he ought to be here by now.
That ought to be enough food for the four of us.
Oughtn't the water to have boiled by now?
